result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J. Tallier

records.addlTxt: 11:08 AM Defendant David J. Tallier not in court. Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for David J. Tallier. Attorney Mary M Sowinski in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF80 & 22CF202. Halyburton does not know Defendant's whereabouts. Sowinski requests warrant be authorized. Court authorizes warrant. adj. 11:10 PM

11:00 AM Judge Mary Burns mentoring with Judge Neal Nielsen. Defendant David J. Tallier in court.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for David J. Tallier.  Attorney Michael Schiek in court for State of Wisconsin. Calling 22CF80, 22CF202. Halyburton - statement; defendant waives preliminary hearing in 22CF202. Court finds waiver free and voluntary; finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Schiek notes Information will be inconsistent with complaint; Information will be single count of felony bail jumping. Halyburton willing to proceed to arraignment/defendant pleads not guilty. Bond continued. adj. 11:07 a.m.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 11:00 am.

2:10 PM Defendant David J. Tallier appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Michael William Schiek in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Breanna Halyburton appearing in court. Calling 22CF202 & 22CF80. 22CF202 set for an initial appearance. In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing. Halyburton statement to other county cases. Schiek/Halyburton/Defendant statement to bail. Victim of overdose is living with him. Defendant to appear at next hearing in person. Court sets bond. Defendant to come to COC office and signed bond in both cases and submit to booking (was to submit by 6/24/22 4pm - not completed) adj. 02:25 PM
Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Answer to demand for discovery and inspection

records.addlTxt:
10:53 AM Prosecuting attorney Mary M. Sowinski appearing by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David J. Tallier appearing by video. Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for David J. Tallier. Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over. Sowinski states Information will be filed that mirrors Complaint. Halyburton willing to proceed to Arraignment today; waives further reading and enters not guilty pleas. Bond continued. adj. 11:05 AM
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
May not be on any Dollar General premises.  To submit to booking by 6-24-22 4pm

1:51 PM Prosecuting attorney Jillian Pfeifer in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant David J. Tallier appeared by video.  Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court for David J. Tallier. 
In receipt, waive reading - request preliminary hearing. Time limits waived. 
Pfeifer to bail - Court sets $  sig bond -  Bond given to Counsel to get signed and returned as defendant works out of town.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
